body_html: The lack of std::is_trivially_destructable is odd. It would imply your version of g++ is too old: we don't support anything without good C++11 support. However, your version of Ubuntu is reasonably recent. What version of g++ do you have? Is there some other reason you'd lack part of the standard library?
body_text: The lack of std::is_trivially_destructable is odd.  It would imply your version of g++ is too old: we don't support anything without good C++11 support.  However, your version of Ubuntu is reasonably recent.  What version of g++ do you have?  Is there some other reason you'd lack part of the standard library?
body: The lack of `std::is_trivially_destructable` is odd.  It would imply your version of g++ is too old: we don't support anything without good C++11 support.  However, your version of Ubuntu is reasonably recent.  What version of g++ do you have?  Is there some other reason you'd lack part of the standard library?
